result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 477 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $18,718.52 is to be paid to Acuity (Joint and Several) as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs or fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling/HSED/GED.
Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with any of the victims or family members of the victims.
Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons.

IT IS ORDERED that the petitioner's motion to reconsider is granted.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the November 9, 2020 order dismissing the petition is vacated.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that on or before February 19, 2021, the petitioner must file an amended petition for writ of habeas corpus that is signed and verified as required by Wisconsin Statute 782.04.  The amended petition will replace the unsigned, unvertified petition previously submitted.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that if the petitioner fails to submit an amended petition for writ of habeau corpus that is signed and verified on or before February 19, 2021, the original petition will be dismissed as defective.

On 9-25-20, the Petitioner was informed that he was to pay the $195.00 filing fee within five days or the petition for writ of habeas corpus would be dismissed.
The filing fee has not been paid and no petition for waiver of the filing fee has been filed.
IT IS ORDERED that the petition is dismissed pursuant to Rule 809.93(2).
Acknowledgement of Filing of Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Dated February 12, 2019.  IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.
Dated February 12, 2019 filed with a certified copy of the Order of the Court of Appeals affirming that was dated September 26, 2018.
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the motion for clarification is granted.  The court's order of October 12, 2018, deeming the pro se filing of defendant-appellant to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review that invokes the jurisdiction of this court remains in effect, but is clarified and modifies as follows.  Attorney Rose shall file with the clerk of this court a supplemental petition for review (identified as a statement in support of the petition for review in the court's prior order) conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. 809.62(2) and (4) on or before November 9, 2018.  Given that the supplemental petition is being prepared by counsel and is already in process, there is no longer a need to extend the deadline for filing until November 26, 2018.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that from this date forward all filings in this court in this matter shall be filed by counsel.  Given that he is represented by counsel, defendant-appellant is not permitted to also represent himself in this court.

IT IS ORDERED that the October 11, 2018 filing shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review.  However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by November 26, 2018.  If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.

IT IS ORDERD that the judgment and the order of the circuit court are summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt: Dated 05/05/16, from the State to Acuity Insurance, regarding restitution.

Defendant Kenneth J Thomas in court, in custody, with Attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Susan L. Opper and Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Attorney Cotton recites some minor corrections to presentence investigation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Cotton makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

45 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 477 DAYS) 
  -  35 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  10 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  

____Absolute Sobriety
____No Use or Possession of illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling/HSED/GED 
____No contact with: any victims or family members of victims
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Not to use or possess and dangerous weapons
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

RESTITUTION:  $18,718.52 to Acuity- Joint and Several (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)


COUNT #7:   IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

20 YEARS IMPRISONMENT          **CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1**
  -  10 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  10 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  

____Absolute Sobriety
____No Use or Possession of illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling/HSED/GED 
____No contact with: any victims or family members of victims
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Not to use or possess and dangerous weapons
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

COSTS:  $278.00  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Kenneth J Thomas in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth for Anthony Cotton.   Susan L. Opper and Mary Brjecha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests all witnesses be excluded from the courtroom. Court grants. Detective Benitez from the City of Waukesha was sworna and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Dr. Zelda Okia was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibit #1 marked and received.  Cross examination by the defense. Detective Edward Bergin from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on the behalf of the State.  Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. Court declares the testimony closed. State moves for bind over. Defense moves for dismissal. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
